definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother

sentences.english: This film is dedicated to all dream chasers with great minds and high aims.
sentences.chinese: 谨以此片献给所有心大志大的追梦人。

sentences.english: Let's think big, ie plan ambitiously.
When I was young, I dreamed of hitching my wagon to a star and becoming a great scientist.
sentences.chinese: 我年青时曾心怀大志，想成为一位大科学家。

sentences.english: Your problem is that you have no ambition.
sentences.chinese: 你的问题在于你胸无大志。

sentences.english: For the divisions of Reuben there were great thoughts of heart.
sentences.chinese: 在流本的众溪旁，有心怀大志的。

sentences.english: He didn't force himself to dream big and to expand the company too fast.
sentences.chinese: 他没有强迫自己去襟怀胸襟大志或是去迅速扩张公司。

sentences.english: Not failure , but low aim , is crime .
sentences.chinese: 失败不为过错，胸无大志才是罪过。

sentences.english: Lack of ambition might be his problem.
sentences.chinese: 他的问题也许是在于胸无大志。

sentences.english: He didn’t force himself to dream big and to expand the company too fast.
sentences.chinese: 他没有强迫自己去胸怀大志或是去迅速扩张公司。

sentences.english: In the biggest persuasion, he finally decided to stay and little brother business together.
sentences.chinese: 在大志的劝说下，小志最终决议留下与哥哥一同创业。

sentences.english: I still had plenty of journalistic ambitions.
sentences.chinese: 我仍然怀有做一名记者的雄心大志。

sentences.english: Most people would succeed in small things if they were not troubled with great ambitions.
sentences.chinese: 对大多数人来说，如果没有宏图大志，只能。

sentences.english: Gender Studies is definitely worth checking out and the English department has changed me from novice writer to aspiring author.
sentences.chinese: 英语专业也使我从一个无名小卒到胸有大志的作家。

sentences.english: David was an aspiring screenwriter and my most reliable friend.
sentences.chinese: 大卫是个胸怀大志的编剧，也是我最信赖的朋友。

sentences.english: Women who seek to be equal with men lack ambition.
sentences.chinese: 追求男性和女性平等的女性缺少大志壮心。

definition: to dedicate oneself to the service of one's country
